titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the L. K. Wiese Paper on early telephone service in Washington State 1962
L.K. Wiese Paper on early telephone service in Washington State
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Cheryl Gunselman.

publicationstmt.publisher: Washington State University Libraries Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Doug Lambeth. 2012
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid written in English. English.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

repository.corpname: Washington State University Libraries, Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections

did.unittitle: Paper on early telephone service in Washington State
did.abstract: This collection consists of a single item, an untitled paper (typescript) on early telephone service in Washington State, described on the first page as: "Paper read on February 22, 1962, by L. K. Wiese, retired Pacific Northwest Bell employee, as part of the Northwest History Lecture Series of the Puget Sound Council for the Social Sciences in conjunction with the Seattle Historical Society and the Seattle Museum of History and Industry."

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a single item, an untitled paper (typescript) on early telephone service in Washington State, described on the first page as: "Paper read on February 22, 1962, by L. K. Wiese, retired Pacific Northwest Bell employee, as part of the Northwest History Lecture Series of the Puget Sound Council for the Social Sciences in conjunction with the Seattle Historical Society and the Seattle Museum of History and Industry."

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

prefercite.p: L. K. Wiese Paper on early telephone service in Washington State, 1962
Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries, Pullman, WA.

acqinfo.p: This item was transferred from the Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections vertical file (VF 1512) in 2011.

processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Cheryl Gunselman.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
